sentence3: She practiced and practiced every day for a year.
sentence4: She got so good she tried out for the school swim team.
sentence5: She made the team and took the team to state!

sentence1: Tameka, who is 6, was afraid to join the girl scouts.
sentence2: She thought she would be left in the woods.
sentence3: Her father told her joining the girl scouts would make her brave.
sentence4: Tameka joined the girl scouts and stayed a member.
sentence5: After high school she joined the military because of her experience.

sentence1: The dog went out to the front.
sentence2: The dog went towards the street.
sentence3: The dog liked the pavement.
sentence4: The dog stopped.
sentence5: His owner was yelling at him.

sentence1: Jim bought his wife a ticket to the opera as a surprise.
sentence2: When Jim gave her the tickets she squealed with delight.
sentence3: They dressed up in their best clothes and had a nice dinner.
sentence4: On the way to the opera their car broke down.
sentence5: They missed the whole first act trying to get the car fixed.

sentence1: Mike was riding his bike to work.
sentence2: He wasn't looking as he sped through a puddle.
sentence3: The bike wheels splashed water up onto his clothes.
sentence4: All of his work suit was damaged with muddy water.
sentence5: Mike still went to work and hoped that no one would mind.

sentence1: Kia had lost her measuring cup.

sentence3: She was forced to eyeball her ingredients.
sentence4: She had never done that and feared the food would be bad.
sentence5: But surprisingly, her casserole came out very tasty!

sentence1: I had been immune to poison ivy my entire life.
sentence2: Two summers ago I went for a walk in the woods.
sentence3: Hours later, itchy bumps formed on my hands.
sentence4: I panicked because I didn't know what was wrong.
sentence5: A friend told me I was no longer immune to poison ivy.

sentence1: Inez took a trip to Guatemala.

sentence3: When she got home, she had the photos made into slides.
sentence4: She invited friends over for a slideshow of her trip.
sentence5: All of Inez's friends politely declined the invitation.

sentence1: Pam had a very volatile illness late in life.
sentence2: She called her family one day to come say goodbye.
sentence3: Her family was set to arrive in two days.
sentence4: Pam thought she would last to seem them.
sentence5: She ended up passing just before their plane landed.

storytitle: Dress for the Job You Want
sentence1: Gary wore sweatpants and a t-shirt to a job interview.
sentence2: The interviewer gave Gary some constructive criticism about his attire.
sentence3: Gary went to the store and bought a nice looking suit.
sentence4: Gary wore the suit to his next job interview.
sentence5: Gary got the new job by impressing the interviewer.

sentence1: Tom wanted to save money.
sentence2: He went to a cheap salon to get his hair done.
sentence3: They wound up messing up his hair.
sentence4: He had to go to a more expensive salon to get it fixed.
sentence5: Tom wound up wasting more money.

sentence1: Laura's mother had passed away.
sentence2: She left Laura a painting she had.
sentence3: Laura had hated the painting and thought it was ugly.
sentence4: Laura got the painting appraised.
sentence5: She was able to sell the painting for a few hundred dollars.

sentence1: I don't have any money to spend.

sentence1: Mary was taking gymnastics classics.

sentence1: Liam loved animals.

sentence1: Jennifer had not received any phone calls for days.

sentence1: Tom was new to using Snapchat.

sentence1: Emily loved ducks a lot.

sentence1: Marsha had a top-secret job.

sentence1: The kids liked playing video games.
